title: How do we know what ancient civilizations actually called themselves? - Quora

response.answer_text: Usually by any writings left behind. The Hittites did not call themselves Hittites. They were the Nesha. This is also true in modern times. The Comanche do not call themselves Comanche nor do the Sioux call themselves Sioux. Look at the real names for the different Berber tribes. They don’t call themselves Berbers. Ancient writings are the best sources for extinct cultures, and listening to what they call themselves for living cultures.

Ideally, by looking up how they called themselves in their text documents in their own language. When such examples or even texts are not available to us, we have to rely on documents in other languages who inform us about those endonyms. However, those names then tend to be “distorted” by the foreign language’s phonology/morphology. If such documents don’t exist, good luck.
